law.catch_line: Administrative regulations for restoration of civil rights to eligible felony offenders.

text.section:
As used in this section, "eligible felony offender" means a person convicted of one (1) or more felonies who:
Has reached the maximum expiration of his or her sentence or has received final discharge from the Parole Board;
Does not have any pending warrants, charges, or indictments; and
Had paid full restitution as ordered by the court or the Parole Board.

As used in this section, "civil rights" means the ability to vote, serve on a jury, obtain a professional or vocational license, and hold an elective office. It does not include the right to bear arms.

Any eligible offender not provided for under subsection (2) of this section may submit an application directly to the Department of Corrections to initiate the process outlined in subsection (1) of this section.

law.history: Created 2001 Ky. Acts ch. 115, sec. 1, effective June 21, 2001.
